reasoning: Transient ischemic attack (TIA) incidence estimated at ~20 per 100k person-years. Reporting incidence as appropriate for acute condition with clear onset. Global estimate with significant variation by age and region.
source: Sacco RL et al. (2013). An updated definition of stroke for the 21st century: a statement for healthcare professionals from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. Stroke. 44(7):2064-2089
